meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by erythema.
meanings.sent1: Her cheeks looked erythemic after spending the day in the sun.
meanings.sent2: The doctor noted the erythemic rash on the patient's arm.
meanings.sent3: The erythemic glow of the sunset painted the sky a beautiful shade of red.
meanings.sent4: The room was filled with an eerie, erythemic light that made everything appear surreal.
meanings.sent5: The artist used bold strokes of erythemic paint to create a striking masterpiece.

meanings.definition: Showing redness of the skin due to capillary congestion.
meanings.sent1: His erythemic nose indicated he had been out in the cold for too long.
meanings.sent2: The erythemic patches on her face were a sign of an allergic reaction.
meanings.sent3: The clown's erythemic nose made him look even sillier.
meanings.sent4: The old house had an erythemic facade that hinted at its haunted past.
meanings.sent5: The erythemic hue of the tomato signaled it was ripe and ready to eat.
